Name: Neural activity induced by sensory stimulation can drive large-scale cerebrospinal fluid flow during wakefulness in humans
Funding: Simons Collaboration on Plasticity in the Aging Brain (no.811231)
National Defense Science and Engineering Graduate Fellowship
HowtoAcknowledge: Please cite the paper and cite Lewis, L. D., Setsompop, K., Rosen, B. R., & Polimeni, J. R. (2018). Stimulus-dependent hemodynamic response timing across the human subcortical-cortical visual pathway identified through high spatiotemporal resolution 7T fMRI. NeuroImage, 181, 279-291. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuroimage.2018.06.056
